definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Can you tell me something about the wiring fee?
sentences.chinese: 您能告訴我關於電匯費的問題嗎？

sentences.english: Please remit the payment by telegraphic transfer to our bank account in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 請將貨款電匯到我們在香港銀行的賬戶裏。

sentences.english: The buyer should pay total amount to seller by T/T within 10 days after receipt of the concerning original B/L.
sentences.chinese: 買方應在收到正本提單後10天內電匯支付全部貨款。

sentences.english: Payment shall be made CWO by means of T/TorM/T.
sentences.chinese: 裝貨付款費用應以電匯或信匯的方式。

sentences.english: Is the payment by cable or mail?
Why did you get a paper check and not wire?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼選用紙質支票，而不用電匯。

sentences.english: Can I wire some money to Hongkong from here?
sentences.chinese: 我可以從這電匯一些錢到香港嗎？

sentences.english: The bank charges 15 dollars for each domestic wire transfer.
sentences.chinese: 這家銀行對於每筆國內電匯酌收十五元。

sentences.english: We propose paying by TT when the shipment is ready.
sentences.chinese: 我們修議在貨物籌備美待運時用電匯付款。

sentences.english: We have telegraphic money orders avaliable for foreign remittances .
sentences.chinese: 我們有向國外匯款的電匯業務。

sentences.english: Do you want to remit the money by air mail or by cable, sir?
sentences.chinese: 您想要航空信匯還是電匯，先生？

sentences.english: Domestic students may pay by credit cards, cashier's check and bank wire.
sentences.chinese: 本土學生可付信用卡，現金支票或電匯。

sentences.english: Of course, it is cheaper than telegraphic transfer.
sentences.chinese: 當然信匯比電匯要便宜多了。

sentences.english: We have accordingly instructed the Shanghai Bank to remit that amount by telegraphic transfer to you.
sentences.chinese: 茲託上海銀行電匯上述款項給貴公司。

sentences.english: L/C to allow T/T reimbursement upon payment maturity.
sentences.chinese: 允許承付到期時以電匯形式支付所承付之款項。

sentences.english: We have already wired $5.000 to your company according to your quoted price.
sentences.chinese: 根據你們的報價，我們已經給貴公司電匯了五千美元。

definition: to transfer (money to a bank account)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
see 無記名|无记名[wu2 ji4 ming2]
